newsitem.title: ROMANIA: ROMANIA OTC MARKET SLIGHTLY DOWN.
newsitem.headline: ROMANIA OTC MARKET SLIGHTLY DOWN.

text.p: Romania's over-the-counter (OTC) market closed slightly weaker on Thursday as most investors were reluctant to buy at high prices, traders said.
They said both foreign and local investors were still waiting for prices declines and stayed away from big deals.
"I think the present situation will continue for a while," one said.
Traders said a fall of the leu during the day to 7,400/500 to the dollar, from its opening level of 7,200/260, had no impact on foreign investors.
"The depreciation of the leu was too small. None of the dollar holders rushed to buy on the assumption of a cheaper leu," one said. "The picture would change at 10,000 to the dollar".
Traders said they expected the downtrend to continue, with supply exceeding demand.
The VAB-RA all-share index fell 0.4 percent from Wednesday's levels to 6,448.3 points.
Gainers led losers by 209 to 127 on Wednesday, while prices for 265 stocks were flat.
Selling pressure weakened prices for cement makers and several other high-caps, including Turbomecanisa SA engine aircraft maker, which closed weaker at 67,000 after it opened at 71,000.
